alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 08 at 3:34AM HST until January 09 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING THROUGH TONIGHT FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY STARTING THIS EVENING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell is spreading down the island chain. This swell will cause surf to build along exposed north and west facing shores of the smaller islands through this afternoon. Surf will likely reach the High Surf Warning criteria along all of these shorelines by this evening. Surf will also likely reach the High Surf Advisory criteria along exposed west facing shores of the Big Island tonight, with surf near the warning criteria there by Sunday morning. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Building surf, with dangerously large breaking waves of 20 to 30 feet later today and tonight. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, and Niihau. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may occasionally impact harbors making navigating the harbor channel dangerous.
info.instruction: Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous currents make entering the water very hazardous. Anyone entering the water could face significant injury or death.

area.areaDesc: Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast
